transcript.text: [Music]
[Music]
you
[Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the
x-ray to report my name is David episode
1275 a and today's date is May 9th 2017
and the title of the episode is Bink
banks pushing smaller banks to merge
deposits before the bank run begins now
before I get started I just want to make
an announcement I uploaded an interview
today with Andy Hoffman it is on the
x-22 report spotlight YouTube channel so
all you need to do is go over to YouTube
type in x-22 report spotlight or bring
right to the video or you can come over
to the x-22 report comm site scroll down
a little bit look over to your right
hand side you'll see the video there and
you can play it right on the site or you
can go over to News Sentinel com same
thing scroll down a little bit look over
the right hand side and you can play the
video right on the site let's get into
the economic collapse financial news now
we've been following home capital goods
for the last week or so maybe even a
little bit longer than that and we've
noticed that things are actually getting
worse and worse for this company
and as of today the company is now in
the mortgage selling business that you
should a press release and the company
announced it has entered into an
arrangement with an undisclosed third
party to sell up to a total of 1.5
billion in funded mortgages and loan
renewals now this is in a desperate
attempt to shore up their liquidity so
what are they doing here well home
capital they added that the deal that
they've made includes up to 1 billion of
uninsured mortgages and 500 million of
insured mortgages or about 10 percent of
the company's total mortgage book well
it didn't really provide the most
important information about all of this
at what price are the mortgages being
sold at and when we look at what they're
doing right now we can see that they're
becoming very desperate why because when
we look at the deposits well they are
continually dwindling now remember when
they first started out five weeks ago
they had about two
billion in deposits as of today May 9th
they are now down to a hundred and forty
six million just yesterday they were at
a hundred what ninety two million or so
so we can see right now they are in big
big trouble and people are waking up
saying you know something I am running
to this mortgage lender and I'm getting
as much as I possibly can out of the
company before the whole thing just
implodes on itself and this is a perfect
example of what will happen when there
are bank runs people are going to run
now think about this if there are
multiple mortgage lenders banks that
have this problem and everyone is
running to the banking system to get
their funds out because they see
something is happening what do you think
they're going to do they're going to
shut it down and I am really surprised
they haven't done this as of yet but we
might see there might be a certain point
where they say okay we hit 125 million
now it's time to shut it down I don't
know why they waited so long but we
could see they're going to do it when
they reach a certain point now we
understand that people are hurting today
in the economy a lot of people losing
their jobs a lot of retail stores
closing a lot of corporations laying off
and people are living day to day with a
certain amount of money sometimes they
don't make it the full month sometimes
they don't have enough money to pay for
food electric and things like that
and especially when there's an emergency
that comes up they just don't have the
funds to pay for this and remember a
couple reports back we reported on how
Americans can't afford to write a $500
check if there's some type of an
emergency and it's not just here in the
United States there was another survey
that was done and half of Canadians have
$200 or less in savings and they are
living on a certain amount of funds they
have just enough to get by each month
and if there is some type of an
emergency they don't have extra funds to
pay for anything and it's not just the
United States and Canada
this is actually happening throughout
the entire world where the private
western central bank system has put all
these countries into so much debt where
there's so much hot with it with the
unemployment is so high we could see
that things are very very difficult for
everyone and it's getting worse and it's
not getting better and what we're seeing
right now is that people are finding it
very difficult to actually just make it
month-to-month because most of the time
their funds run out either in the middle
or right at the end of the month and
they need that next check too
just to get by and what happens is as we
go as these people go from one month to
the next month it doesn't improve it
actually gets worse because it gets
harder and harder and this is why we see
people taking two three four part-time
jobs and this is why when we look at the
unemployment numbers we realize that
there's no way that this 4.4 percent
unemployment can be absolutely true
because most of the unemployment numbers
are completely manipulated and they're
counting all these multiple part-time
jobs as full-time jobs and this is where
they're actually getting the number but
when we look at wages and we look at
what's really going on we can see that
what they're trying to spoon-feed us it
doesn't make any sense and we have proof
of this because we can see that
everything is accelerating to the
downside forget about the stock market
we know the banks we know the central
bank we know central banks around the
world they've been buying as many stocks
as they possibly can to prop up the
entire system when we look at what's
really going on here in the United
States or Canada we can see that retail
is contracting manufacturing is
contracting industrial productions
contracting wages are falling this is
all happening because people are losing
jobs and they're not getting the high
paying job they're going out and finding
part-time jobs if they can and if they
can't they're just not working and
they're that's why there's more and more
people on food stamps this is why more
and more people aren't welfare this is
why we
see all of this happening today and when
we look at Gallup and their report it
shows that confidence right now is
slumping and when people look at the
economy they say well it doesn't look
like being the economy is improving at
all it's actually getting worse and
according to Gallup this number
continually rises where people are
saying that the economy is getting worse
right now forty-nine percent say that no
the economy is not getting better it is
getting worse and this is up from 45%
and what we're seeing is that people are
starting to realize now that there's
something wrong especially those
individuals that are losing their jobs
they're saying okay I lost my job I
can't find another job
what is going on here you're telling me
that we're in full employment at four
point four percent but I cannot find
work or if I do find work
it's either part-time jobs or my salary
is much much lower something is wrong
here now we see wholesale sales well
growth has stalled now in March and when
we look at this it is the weakest in
eight months
lumber sales they have plummeted by 3%
they are down now every time they tell
us that new construction is up and
things are getting better and houses are
being built and how could this be true
because lumber is continually declining
so something is wrong with what they are
saying and we see already that the
Atlanta Fed they have already dropped
their estimate from four point two
percent of GDP now it is down to three
point six percent GDP and we will see
this all throughout this quarter until
they end up most likely below 1% once
again unless they come in and they
massively manipulate this number by
pushing soybeans out there or something
else and this is what they've done
before now very interestingly the Fed is
reporting that there's been an
unexpected collapse in credit card and
auto loan demand really unexpected maybe
the people just don't have the funds
right down
and what's happening here is the Fed is
not even believing their own data they
don't believe their own survey on the
spending growth projections and they're
saying that no the spending growth it's
fine this is just another anomaly and
it's something that we don't have to be
concerned about but the problem is is
that consumers they are tapped out most
of the credit cards are at the limit and
people are saying listen I can't even
afford the payments now on the credit
cards and if I add more it just will
make things worse and plus the limits
are at the top right now and people are
slowing down their spending now think
about this we talked about how
everything is contracting in the economy
and seventy percent of the GDP is made
up of consumer spending the economy runs
on the consumer and if they're not
spending if they're not putting more and
more of their expenditures on their
credit cards spending continually
decreases and this is what they're
seeing and this is why we see retail
contracting because when you lose your
job you don't have the extra money and
this is exactly what we're seeing now
remember the stock market right now is
being propped up by central banks around
the world and we understand this because
we discussed how the central banks are
pumping in 200 to 250 billion every
quarter into the stock market and we
know that Switzerland came out and they
admitted that they have purchased Apple
stock and we can see right now they've
purchased billions and billions of the
stock and we have to remember what makes
up the sp500
they are made up of a handful of tech
companies Apple Amazon Microsoft and
alphabet and these are the single most
popular companies on the planet with
every fund manager and even a Swiss
National Bank loading up on them now if
we remove these companies from the
market the markets are down right now
why does this matter because the
fundamentals for these companies are
rolling over and the investment crowd
will soon be running to the exits take
Apple sales for apples number one
the iPhone well it began to decline a
year ago they declined in three of the
last four quarters on a year-over-year
basis now throughout the same time
period the company's stock price has
risen an astounding 75 percent so Apple
stock has risen by 75 percent during the
time the number one product is selling
less and it's trailing 12-month revenues
are below its 2015 results so why does
the stocks keep going up because the
central banks are pumping this up that
is why now the IMF in their notes they
admitted something very interesting that
corporate credit fundamentals have
started to weaken creating conditions
that have historically preceded a credit
cycle downturn now we're hearing a lot
about this and we need to go back to
what Bill halter said during one of the
interviews that I had with him that the
credit market is going to freeze up and
once that freezes up there will be no
deliveries to stores things are going to
completely break down now what we're
seeing right now is that the IMF in
their notes they're actually admitting
to this and what they're saying is that
another concern according to the IMF is
that the average interest coverage ratio
which measures the ability for
corporations current earnings to cover
its interest expenses has shown a sharp
drop over the past two years the
researchers write that earnings have
dropped to less than six times
interest expense close to the weakest
multiple since the onset of the global
financial crisis now this is where it
gets interesting the report notes
further that historically deterioration
of the interest coverage ratio
corresponds with eventual widening and
credit spreads for risky corporate debt
so the credit market is freezing up
corporations are going to be in trouble
and then we have JPMorgan Chase out
there and they just said something very
interesting today JP Morgan
is offering regional banks some
interesting advice partner up as US
deposit drain looms wait what do they
just say partner up as US deposit drain
looms the company's investment bankers
are warning depository clients that they
may begin feeling the crunch in December
thanks to a byproduct of how the US
Federal Reserve propped up the economy
after the financial crisis now this is
according to a copy of confidential
presentation obtained by Bloomberg News
and confirmed by JPMorgan spokesman
JPMorgan argues that some midsize US
banks those with fifty billion in assets
or less could face a funding problem in
coming years as the Fed goes about
shrinking its massive balance sheet now
what I think they're really doing right
now they realize that the system is
coming down and what they want to do is
they want to consolidate all the
deposits why it's not to help the people
believe me it's not to help the small
banks either they're going to be
completely wiped out what they're
planning to do is they're trying to
consolidate the deposits so they are
protected when the financial crisis hits
and they are saying that they believe
that this is going to come at the latter
part of this year they're not saying
wait till December they're saying do it
now and they're talking about smaller
banks because what they will need is
more deposits because they're expecting
to use the balance to keep the banks
afloat so they want all the smaller
banks to basically partner up with the
bigger banks to make sure everyone is
protected so to me and to what they're
saying here is they're broadcasting that
you better do this now before it's too
late and JPMorgan Chase does nothing for
the people they're doing it for
themselves they're doing nothing
or the smaller banks doing it for
themselves and what they're doing is
they're preparing and getting ready for
this major economic downturn and they're
preparing their bank and their system
for this and we know that they have the
beylin documents not they specifically
but the FDIC the Bank of England Canada
Europe they all are prepared and ready
to shut down the system and to use your
deposits to prop up the banks which
means you will not have access to those
deposits they will take control of all
of it just like they did in Cyprus
so get ready get prepared because
they're just broadcasting right now
exactly what's going to happen
listen everyone thanks a lot for
listening be well be safe and especially
be prepared thanks a lot
[Music]
you
[Music]
you
